metadata.title: Convert Teaspoons to Milliliters — Kitchen Converter
metadata.description: Fast, authoritative conversion between teaspoons and milliliters with accuracy notes, common variants, examples, and safety considerations for cooking and medication dosing.

introduction: This converter converts a quantity in teaspoons to milliliters using the standard metric relationship for a US culinary teaspoon. It is intended for kitchen recipes, general household measurements, and non-critical medication dosing conversions where spoon measures are used as a convenience.

The tool reports a mathematically exact conversion using the commonly accepted US teaspoon volume. Users should apply rounding appropriate to their use case and follow professional or legal dosing instruments for clinical or high-precision requirements.
methodology: The conversion uses the established unit relationship for a US teaspoon: 1 teaspoon (US, customary culinary) equals 4.92892159375 milliliters. This value aligns with national metrology guidance and international unit definitions.

Where other teaspoon definitions exist (for example, a metric teaspoon often defined as exactly 5 mL), the converter documents the standard used and provides guidance on when to use the metric convenience value versus the more precise US teaspoon value.

Accuracy caveats: measuring spoons and household utensils vary in manufactured tolerance, surface tension effects can alter liquid volume readings, and dense or packed solids displace differently than free-flowing liquids. For medication or regulated dosing, use calibrated medical devices and follow institutional or regulatory guidance.
how_is_calculated: Step 1: Start with the input in teaspoons (tsp).
Step 2: Multiply the teaspoon value by 4.92892159375 to obtain milliliters (mL).
Rounding: choose an appropriate displayed precision. For cooking, two significant digits is often sufficient; for medication or lab use, follow device precision and regulatory requirements.

faqs.question: Is a teaspoon always 5 mL?
faqs.answer: No. In many culinary contexts a metric teaspoon is treated as exactly 5 mL for convenience, but the precise US teaspoon volume used for scientific conversion is 4.92892159375 mL. Use 5 mL only when a recipe or source explicitly uses the metric teaspoon convention.

faqs.question: Can I use this converter for medication dosing?
faqs.answer: This converter provides a mathematical conversion but is not a substitute for calibrated medical measuring devices. For medication dosing, follow prescribed instructions and use dosing devices designed and labeled for medical use. Refer to institutional protocols and regulatory guidance.

faqs.question: How many decimal places should I use?
faqs.answer: Choose precision based on context: cooking usually tolerates rounding to two significant digits, laboratory work requires reporting uncertainties per metrology standards, and medication dosing should match the precision of the dosing device. Document any rounding applied.

faqs.question: Why might my measuring spoon give a different result?
faqs.answer: Manufactured measuring spoons have tolerances; wear, surface curvature, and how the liquid is leveled affect the actual volume delivered. For critical work, calibrate volumetric equipment against traceable standards.

glossary.definition: A customary culinary teaspoon commonly used in the United States; defined for conversion purposes as exactly 4.92892159375 milliliters in metrology references.
A convenience culinary measure often treated as exactly 5 milliliters; used in some recipes and packaging but not the metrology definition applied for precise conversions.
One thousandth of a liter, the SI-derived unit for volume commonly used in medicine, cooking, and science.
The process of comparing and adjusting measurement instruments against a known standard to reduce measurement uncertainty and ensure traceability.
Permissible variation in a manufactured item's dimension or volume; measuring spoons have tolerances that affect real-world volume delivery.

summary: Use the precise factor 4.92892159375 mL per US teaspoon for exact conversions and note the common 5 mL metric teaspoon approximation used in some recipes.
For critical applications such as medication dosing or laboratory measurement, use calibrated devices and follow NIST, ISO, and applicable regulatory guidance.
